questions.question: Why does Juliet visit Friar Laurence in Scene 1?
questions.answer: To seek help to avoid marrying Paris

questions.answer: The audience knows the plan; the Capulets do not

questions.question: What evidence shows Friar’s role as plot-engineer?

questions.answer: From wedding preparation to tragic mourning swiftly

questions.question: What irony pervades the wedding preparations?

questions.question: What staging details heighten the tragedy?
questions.answer: Music halted, flowers repurposed, bodies borne

questions.question: How do these scenes set up the Act 5 catastrophe?

questions.question: Which themes intensify through 13–16?

questions.answer: Audience knows the beggar’s identity; characters do not

What preparations ensure the suitors’ vulnerability?
questions.answer: Weapons removed; doors secured; allies positioned

questions.question: How do these books set up 21–24?

questions.question: What internal conflict does Macbeth express in his soliloquy?

questions.question: What does the dagger soliloquy reveal?

questions.question: What do Malcolm and Donalbain decide?

questions.question: How does dramatic irony operate in these scenes?
questions.answer: Audience knows the truth; characters suspect but cannot prove
